tool_description: Calculates Type A (statistical) uncertainty from repeated measurements using statistical methods according to ISO/IEC Guide 98-3 (GUM).
error_messages: Insufficient measurements: Minimum 3 repeated measurements required for Type A uncertainty.
Invalid confidence level: Must be 0.90, 0.95, or 0.99.
Non-numeric values: All measurements must be numerical values.
Zero variance detected: All measurements are identical, cannot calculate statistical uncertainty.
usage: Input repeated measurement values and desired confidence level. Tool calculates standard uncertainty, degrees of freedom, and t-factor according to GUM guidelines.

standard_uncertainty.description: Type A standard uncertainty (standard error of mean)

t_factor.description: Student's t-factor for given confidence level
